title: Apply Multiple Algorithms to the same Training Set without repeating Oracle Mode

labels.name: front-end
labels.description: Issues related to front-end, UX and UI

body:
## Feature Request

**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Currently, the selection of training algorithm, i.e. Na√Øve Bayes, SVM etc. is allowed/presented only once, after the initial Oracle mode. But what if I want to reuse my labelled set and apply next algorithm to the same set, without going through the same cycle of marking records as 'relevant' or 'irrelevant'? This way, I can compare the results on same training set by different algorithms. 
At present, this is possible, but by creating a new project, where I have to upload the previously labelled dataset as input. It would be easier if I could achieve multiple result files, by selecting different algorithms within the same project. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
On the dashboard screen, creating a new option/button called "Retrain".

1. Retrain
2. Select algorithm
... (and following steps as the first training cycle).


**Describe alternatives you've considered**
As an alternative, the same could be done by importing a saved project, and applying another training on the input set. However, there's a problem with this, which is reported separately.
